1 - Introduction
Sword's Google Service Provider (SCS) is a connector framework for the Google Search Appliance.
It supports both Google’s SAML SPI and Connector Manager SPI.
Its purpose is to handle:
  • indexing of remote sources ;
  • user authentication ;
  • users group membership retrieval ;
  • authorization of secure documents ;
  • and/or serving of secure documents.
2 - Hardware requirements
Minimal hardware requirements are as follows:
  • 64 bits platforms:
    • 2GB of dedicated RAM which, according to Java best practice, requires 4GB of physical memory ;
    • 2GHz processor ;
    • 500 MB disk space.
  • 32 bits platforms:
    • 1GB of dedicated RAM which, according to Java best practice, requires 2GB of physical memory ;
    • 2GHz processor ;
    • 500 MB disk space.
For optimal performances, the following requirements apply:
  • 64 bits platforms:
    • 1.5GB of RAM plus ;
    • 512MB of RAM per connector hosted by the server ;
    • 2 × 2GHz processor ;
    • 500MB disk space plus ;
    • 10kB disk space per document included in the indexing scope (i.e. if you plan to index 100.000 documents, you will need 1GB additional disk space).
  • 32 bits platforms:
    • 768MB of RAM plus ;
    • 256MB of RAM per connector hosted by the server ;
    • 2 × 2GHz processor ;
    • 500MB disk space plus ;
    • 10kB disk space per document included in the indexing scope (i.e. if you plan to index 100.000 documents, you will need 1GB additional disk space).
3 - Software requirements
Supported operating systems are:
  • Linux (CentOS, Debian-based distributions, RedHat) ;
  • Microsoft Windows Server (2003 or above).
A web browser with full support for HTML 5 is required to use the SCS Web Manager web application.
4 - Network requirements
The HTTP port numbers that the SCS will use are configured after installation - you will need one port for HTTP and one port for HTTPS.
The server HTTP and HTTPS ports must be reachable from:
  • the GSA if registered, for most operations ;
  • any end-user machine when the SCS is configured to perform SAML authentication.
The server also needs to have access to the API endpoints its connectors connect to. Refer to each connector documentation for more information about these endpoints.
